description:
The Matsuno sextuplets (leader Osomatsu, wannabe tough guy Karamatsu, straight man Choromatsu, cynical Ichimatsu, cheerfully stupid Jyushimatsu and lovable spoiled Todomatsu) are now in their 20s, still living together in the same house as NEETs. Their neighbors still include such eccentric characters as fish market idol Totoko, loud bucktoothed troublemaker Iyami, tiny rival Chiba, wacky inventor Dekapan, and giant mouthed glutton Dayon.

Join the Matsuno siblings as they overcome mundane hurdles in their daily lives, such as finding employment, figure out who should pay the bar bill, and who should get the extra pastry!

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Cute Boys Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around male characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Hikikomori
tags.description: Prominently features a character who withdraws from social life, often seeking extreme isolation.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Satire
tags.description: Prominently features the use of comedy or ridicule to expose and criticise social phenomena.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Femboy
tags.description: Features a boy who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of girls.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/58120205)

Originating from [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/).

He first came to prominence as the director who overtook [Shinji Takamatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/100152/) on [Gintama](https://anilist.co/anime/918/) from episode 100 onwards. He stepped down from the role after the [2013 movie](https://anilist.co/anime/15335/), but remained as a supervisor for the series until the end.

Also known for series such as [Osomatsu-san](https://anilist.co/anime/21261/) and [Binbougami ga!](https://anilist.co/anime/13535/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YukaliHashimoto) | [Blog (jp)](http://blog.livedoor.jp/marianne_amplifier/)

She is a composer, arranger and synthesizer programmer.
__Hiromi Kikuta__ is a Japanese sound director, who works for the company Rakuonsha.

__Likes:__ Mahjong, Shogi, Baseball

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/matsubara2)
**Fujio Akatsuka** was a pioneer Japanese artist of comical manga known as the "Gag Manga King".
Praised nationwide for his work as a character designer on [Osomatsu-san](https://anilist.co/anime/21261/).
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/田村せいき)

__Height:__ 174 cm (5'8'') 

[Profile](https://intention-k.com/profile/kenichi_suzumura) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/suzu__kensan)

His favorite animals are dogs, and he has two dogs named Ivy and Momo. His favorite foods are curry and Pino ice cream. He enjoys cooking and playing video games. He can speak in the Kansai-ben dialect. He has a younger brother, Masaki, and an older sister, Shizuka. He has practiced aikido.  

He left Artvision in 2012 and has found his own talent agency INTENTION. He is part of the voice actor unit STA☆MEN, alongside Junichi Suwabe, Daisuke Kishio, Hiroki Takahashi, Hiroyuki Yoshino, Makoto Yasumura, and Kousuke Toriumi. They performed the ending theme for the Tokusatsu drama "Go Busters" of the Super Sentai Series and released it as their third single. He's also part of CONNECT, first unit of Kiramune, with Mitsuo Iwata. They released three mini-albums and a single. As a solo artist, he has released 13 singles, 3 albums and 2 mini-albums.  

Married frequent costar [Maaya Sakamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/95090/Maaya-Sakamoto) on August 8, 2011.

**Height:** 174 cm (5'8.5")

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/onoDofficial) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/onodofficial/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHuKRxu3ILwezuNBjpxkIxg) | [Website](http://daisukeono.com/) | [Profile (Lantis)](http://www.lantis.jp/artist.php?id=f4165cba759b0eccd6448d4e72b4d9ad)

**Non-Anime Roles**:
- Jing Yuan - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Wriothesley - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Van Arkride - The Legend of Heroes Series (VG)

__Height:__ 173 cm
__Skills & Abilities:__ Kendo

[Profile (Pony Canyon)](https://www.ponycanyon.co.jp/artist/31356600) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/black_fukuyama)

Fukuyama released his debut music album "Romantic World 31" on his birthday (November 26) in 2009, his second album "Love Letters 2: Paris Romantic" on July 21, 2010, his third album "Fukuyama Jun, Ai wo Utau!" on May 25, 2011, and his fourth album "Love Letter 3 ~Matsuri no Kuni de~" on May 22, 2013. He also appeared in a 2009 romantic comedy movie Fujoshi Kanojo in a cameo role.

**Non-anime roles:**
- [Joker](https://anilist.co/character/121590/Ren-Amamiya) - Persona 5
- Renya Goutou - 13 Sentinels: Aegis Rim
- [Camu](https://anilist.co/character/278324/Camu) - Punishing: Gray Raven
- [Kamui](https://anilist.co/character/259960) - Punishing: Gray Raven
- Vyn Richter - Tears of Themis
- Martin - Rune Factory 5
- Hugo - Zenless Zone Zero
- Logos - Arknights

[Agency Profile](https://junction99.com/?page_id=1134)

He joined a theater troupe when he was 4 years old, and two years later made his acting debut in the historical drama Korczak. He remained with the theater troupe until March 2006, when he moved to Junction.

Made his voice acting debut in 1996 on [Taiho Shichauzo](https://anilist.co/anime/1577/). He auditioned and got the role of [Haku](https://anilist.co/character/385/) in the 2001 film [Spirited Away](https://anilist.co/anime/199/). The same year, he voiced the eponymous main character in [PaRappa The Rapper](https://anilist.co/anime/3736/), and the following year he started voicing Sora in the Kingdom Hearts video game series, a character who he still voices to this day.

He released his debut mini-album Soleil on June 26, 2009 and his first single album, Faith, on November 25, 2009. Since May 2010, he and [Hiroshi Kamiya](https://anilist.co/staff/95118/) formed a music duo called [KAmiYU](https://anilist.co/staff/116031/). Their first mini-album "link-up" was released on August 3, 2011.

Announced his marriage with an unspecified woman on September 3, 2021.

__Non-anime voice roles:__
- Sora - *Kingdom Hearts* series (VG)
- Cyno - *Genshin Impact* (VG)

**Height:** 167 cm (5'6") 
**Other:** Named his cat "Nyanko-Sensei" 
**Agency:** Aoni

[Profile](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/kamiya-hiroshi.html)

On January 1st 2025 it was announced that he had gotten married to actress and gravure model Rina Aizawa.

**Awards:**
- 2008-03: Best Supporting Actor, 2nd Annual Seiyuu Awards
- 2009-03: Best Lead Actor and Best Personality, 3rd Annual Seiyuu Awards
- 2012-03: Most Votes Award, 6th Annual Seiyuu Awards
- 2013-03: Most Votes Award, 7th Annual Seiyuu Awards  

Hosts several radio talk shows, including Dear Girl ~Stories~ with Ono Daisuke. In May 2010, he and Miyu Irino formed a Kiramune unit called KAmiYU, and sang the theme song for Mokei Senshi Gunpla Builders Beginning G.  Their first mini-album "link-up" was released on August 3, 2011.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Neuvillette in Genshin Impact
- Shou Ronpo in Uchu Sentai Kyuranger
- Madrex in Bakuage Sentai Boonboomger

__Height:__ 175 cm

[Profile](https://intention-k.com/profile/yuichi_nakamura) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nakamuraFF11) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCReBAqqC-hc9d70gOftfitg) | [Personal YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3eYAvjCVwNHgkaGbXX3sig)

**Trivia:**
- His nickname "Yuu-kyan" was given by Kenichi Suzumura.
- Very close with Tomokazu Sugita. They host a video game variety show called Tokyo Encounter together.
- Loves cats but is afraid of having them die before him, so doesn't have any of his own.
- Allergic to metals and alcohol; drinks non-alcoholic soft drinks or orange juice at parties.
- Colorblind.

__Non-Anime Roles:__

- Louis Guiabern - Metaphor: ReFantazio (VG)

__Height:__ 177 cm (5'9.75")

On October 26, 2022, it was reported that Sakurai had been engaging in an extramarital affair with a writer of his *P.S. Genki Desu. Takahiro* radio program. A month prior, it was publicly disclosed that he had been married to a former voice actress for nearly 20 years, although the writer had allegedly not been aware of his marriage as they had been in a relationship for 10 years and intending to marry. His previously announced roles as [Haruaki Karuma](https://anilist.co/character/290233) in [AYAKA](https://anilist.co/anime/155982/AYAKA/) and [Kusuriuri](https://anilist.co/character/2865) in [Mononoke (Movie)](https://anilist.co/anime/151117/Mononoke-Movie/) had been recast as a result.

On March 31, 2023, it was jointly announced with his talent agency "Intention" that they are ending their contract, as Sakurai requested to leave as a way of taking sole responsibility of his actions and for self-reflection.

Non-Anime Roles:
-Passenger in "Arknights" (VG/Mobile) (Japanese)
-Su in "Honkai Impact 3rd" (VG) (Japanese)
-Cloud Strife in "FINAL FANTASY 7 REMAKE" (Japanese)
Crow Armbrust - The Legend of Heroes Series (VG)
Known for his involvement in the [Naruto](https://anilist.co/anime/1735/) franchise.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/265852551)

Married to fellow animator [Noriko Morishima](https://anilist.co/staff/111797/).

**Notable works outside anime:**
- Final Fantasy VII (Video Game, 1997) (2D Animation Assistance)
- Final Fantasy X (Video Game, 2001) (Storyboard Design)
- Final Fantasy XII (Videogame, 2006) (Storyboard)
- Crisis Core: Final Fantasy VII (Video Game, 2007) (Continuity Design)
- Final Fantasy IV (Video Game, 2007) (Storyboard)
- Final Fantasy XIII (Video Game, 2009) (Storyboard Design)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/chau_kotori)

Graduated from Kyoto Seika University in 2012. Japanese animator, director and storyboard artist. Leader and founder of Studio Colorido's Team Yamahitsuji since fall 2018.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kuro_96chang)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/松本憲生)

Originating from Tatsunoko's animators training institute, where he met [Atsushi Wakabayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/105805/). Though primarily an action animator, he’s demonstrated impressive range elsewhere like in his scenes for [Haibane Renmei](https://anilist.co/anime/387/) and [Kaguya-hime](https://anilist.co/anime/16664/). He has the reputation of a fast and disciplined worker. [Toshiyuki Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/103724/) said that he must have a “secret” for producing such a large volume of superb cuts.

Though one of his earliest assignments was as an in-betweens checker for [Akira](https://anilist.co/anime/47/), his first major job was on [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/), working under the director of the series, [Kazuhiro Furuhashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100655/). He would collaborate with Furuhashi again on Rurouni Kenshin, [You’re Under Arrest](https://anilist.co/anime/1577/), and [Hunter x Hunter](https://anilist.co/anime/136/). Around this time Matsumoto was also mentored by [Tomohiro Hirata](https://anilist.co/staff/122071/) on [Irresponsible Captain Tylor](https://anilist.co/anime/569/).

Matsumoto’s character animation is loose and full of smears, often looking like featureless masses in individual frames. He draws smoke without highlights, a tendency that earned the nickname “Norio smoke” and has been imitated by animators like [Shingo Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/114914/) and [Kenichi Kutsuna](https://anilist.co/staff/116007/). He occasionally storyboards his own scenes as he did for the 12th episode of [Birdy Decode:02](https://anilist.co/anime/5074/), the [third Naruto movie](https://anilist.co/anime/2144/), and episodes 31 & 85 of [Rurouni Kenshin](https://anilist.co/anime/45/). Prefers battles that take place in wide-open spaces with lots of forward momentum and background movement. Influenced by [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/) and [Takashi Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/102031/), and has adapted elements of their approach for a wider audience.

Whenever he serves as animation director on an episode, he does a lot of the key animation work himself. He also soloed the 7th episode of [Eat-Man](https://anilist.co/anime/1704/) and the [Kuragehime](https://anilist.co/anime/8129/) ED. He failed attempting to solo the 39th episode of You’re Under Arrest, and requested his name not be on the telop despite animating the vast majority of the episode.

Famous for his work on the [Naruto](https://anilist.co/anime/20/) franchise, in which he often collaborated with Atsushi Wakabayashi.

As a well known animator with a wide network of connections, he regularly helps and receives help from his friends.

(Source: Animators Wiki)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ultra_m_nom)
